Course.Title: PRINCIPLES OF ECONOMCS I
Course.Description: The American Economy; aggregate economics with emphasis on the relationships of income, consumption, savings and investment; money and banking, economic growth and the role of government. The 1020-1021 sequence may be taken in either order.

Sections.CourseDescription: The American Economy; aggregate economics with emphasis on the relationships of income, consumption, savings and investment; money and banking, economic growth and the role of government. The 1020-1021 sequence may be taken in either order.

Course.Title: CHALLENGES OF GLOBAL POVERTY
Course.Description: This course offers a radical rethinking of the economics of poverty in both the Global South and the Global North. It shows how economics, when done right, can help comprehensive insight on poverty around the globe through the semester-long reading and writing intensive course. Conducting research on poverty issues preconditions students for graduate schools, and prepares them to be self-directed and creative for governmental, NGOs, and not-for-profit jobs, as well as being a responsible global citizen. It is a signature course in Economics program.

Sections.CourseDescription: This course offers a radical rethinking of the economics of poverty in both the Global South and the Global North. It shows how economics, when done right, can help comprehensive insight on poverty around the globe through the semester-long reading and writing intensive course. Conducting research on poverty issues preconditions students for graduate schools, and prepares them to be self-directed and creative for governmental, NGOs, and not-for-profit jobs, as well as being a responsible global citizen. It is a signature course in Economics program.
MeetingsDisplay: Monday, Thursday 8:30 AM - 9:45 AM COLL BUSINESS&PUBLIC MGT A204 (Lecture)
Sections.Comments: WENZHOU-KEAN STUDENTS ONLY BUSINESS STUDENTS ONLY. Sophomore ECO first
Sections.Title: CHALLENGES OF GLOBAL POVERTY

Course.Title: INTERMEDIATE MACROECONOMICS
Course.Description: Introduction to the underlying logic and inner workings of the major macroeconomic aggregates and their components. Emphasis on the understanding of the theory of the business cycle, the Keynesian model of aggregate demand and supply, and to the neoclassical model of macroeconomic equilibrium.

Sections.CourseDescription: Introduction to the underlying logic and inner workings of the major macroeconomic aggregates and their components. Emphasis on the understanding of the theory of the business cycle, the Keynesian model of aggregate demand and supply, and to the neoclassical model of macroeconomic equilibrium.
MeetingsDisplay: Monday, Wednesday 1:00 PM - 2:15 PM COLL BUSINESS&PUBLIC MGT C324 (Lecture)
Sections.Comments: WENZHOU-KEAN STUDENTS ONLY. sophomore FIN/ECO only
Sections.Title: INTERMEDIATE MACROECONOMICS

Course.Description: Students study and analyze the dynamics of public policy as it impacts schools, school districts and communities at large.

Course.Title: LEGAL & POLICY ISSUES IN EDUC
Course.Description: Addresses legal and policy issues in public education, with special emphasis on New Jersey schools.

Course.Title: INTRO TO STATISTICAL METHODS
Course.Description: The focus of this first course in Statistics will be to introduce statistical concepts and methods that would help the doctoral students to learn the language of statistics, to use appropriate statistical procedures and gain domain knowledge and analysis skills to interpret data and draw valid inferences.

Sections.CourseDescription: The focus of this first course in Statistics will be to introduce statistical concepts and methods that would help the doctoral students to learn the language of statistics, to use appropriate statistical procedures and gain domain knowledge and analysis skills to interpret data and draw valid inferences.
MeetingsDisplay: Monday 6:45 PM - 9:30 PM WKU General Education Hall A205 (Lecture)
Sections.Title: INTRO TO STATISTICAL METHODS

Course.Title: QUALITATIVE RESEARCH METHODS
Course.Description: This course will introduce doctoral students to the philosophy and methods of qualitative research. Through an examination of the evolution of qualitative methods to the practice of different strategies of inquiry, students will develop the skills necessary to design and conduct qualitative research.

Sections.CourseDescription: This course will introduce doctoral students to the philosophy and methods of qualitative research. Through an examination of the evolution of qualitative methods to the practice of different strategies of inquiry, students will develop the skills necessary to design and conduct qualitative research.
MeetingsDisplay: Tuesday 6:45 PM - 9:30 PM WKU General Education Hall A205 (Lecture)
Sections.Title: QUALITATIVE RESEARCH METHODS
